title: 3/22/23 - Committee on Retirement
summary:
Overview:
This session of the Georgia Legislature's Committee on Retirement focused on a single bill, SB 308, which sought to extend a recent increase in retirement benefits for current members of the General Assembly to those who had already retired when the change was made.

Key Actions:
**SB 308**: Extending a recent increase in retirement benefits for current members of the Georgia General Assembly to those who had already retired.

Bills Introduced (First Reading):
None detected.

Notable Moments:
The committee chair presented the bill on behalf of the absent sponsor, Senator Harbin. A committee member expressed support for extending the retirement benefit increase to retirees, stating they are "very deserving of this retirement."

Votes:
The committee voted to pass SB 308 on to the actuary for further review.

Attendance:
A quorum was present, and the session was able to conduct business.

Adjournment:
The committee adjourned after addressing the single item on the agenda.
